content.text: ● Place the \(18\Omega\) resistor in component holder R
● Set up the circuit shown in Fig. 1.1
The resistor in R has resistance \(R\). Record \(R\)
Change the resistor in R and repeat (a) until you have six sets of readings of \(R\) and \(V.\) Include your values from (a)
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(\frac{1}{R}\) and \(\frac{1}{V}\) in your table
Plot a graph of \(\frac{1}{V}\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(\frac{1}{R}\) on the \(x\)-axis
Draw the straight line of best fit
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line
It is suggested that the quantities \(V\) and \(R\) are related by the equation
Using your answers in **(c)**(iii), determine values for \(A\) and \(B\)
where \(E\) is the electromotive force (e.m.f.) of the cell
The two other resistors in the circuit each have resistance \(X\)
In this experiment, you will investigate an electrical circuit
You have been provided with a metre rule with two springs attached
The distance between one end of the metre rule and the string is \(L\), as shown in Fig. 2.1
● Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 2.2
Adjust the apparatus until the horizontal distance between the centres of the rods of the clamps is equal to your value of \(\frac{L}{n}\)
Adjust the heights of the bosses so that the rule is horizontal and the springs are vertical and **unstretched** when the rule is held in position
Gradually release the rule by lowering your hand. The rule will tilt
The angle between the rule and the horizontal is \(\theta\), as shown in Fig. 2.3
Estimate the percentage uncertainty in your value of \(\theta\). Show your working
Justify the number of significant figures that you have given for your value of \(\sin \theta\)
Repeat **(b)**(i) and **(b)**(iii) using this value of \(\frac{l}{n}\)
Using your data, calculate two values of C
Explain whether your results support the suggested relationship
It is suggested that the relationship between \(\theta\) and \(n\) is
\(M\) is the mass of the metre rule given on the card
\(k\) is the spring constant of the spring system
Use your second value of \(C\) to determine a value for \(k\). Give appropriate units
Describe four sources of uncertainty or limitations of the procedure for this experiment
You may not need to use all of the materials provided
In this experiment, you will investigate the equilibrium of a metre rule
